titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev Bronk, Biographical and Personal material
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev Bronk, Biographical and Personal material FA964
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Carolyn Kopp

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-17 10:17:39 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev Bronk, Biographical and Personal material

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

p.extref: FA140 Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev W. Bronk, Administrative papers
FA914 Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev W. Bronk, General and Professional correspondence
FA965 Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev W. Bronk, Personal and Professional papers

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev W. Bronk materials are arranged into 4 components:
See "other finding aids" note in this guide for directly links to the other Bronk holdings.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Material in the Rockefeller family collections that provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller family, and/or documents the net wealth of any Rockefeller family members, is restricted. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Audiovisual materials were separated from the body of the collection for specialized storage. Some formats are currently not playable inhouse at the RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of Bronk's biographical materials, personal correspondence, memoranda, documentation of awards, memberships, lectures, etc.

did.unittitle: Additions to (those not in NAS list)
Correspondence re: Ruth Sternfeld. re: missing reprints
American Philosophical Society Yearbook. Britton Chance. photocopy.
National Academy of Sciences, 1979, Vol. 50. Frank Brink, Jr. Reprint
Royal Society of London. Lord Adrian. 1976, Vol 22.
N.A.S. Archives (Jean St. Clair), 1977. Enclosure, copy of letter from DWB/Lyman Chalkley, 1947 July 19.
Mabel Bright/Paul Cranefield (and enclosures). Re: Preben Ramlov inquiry on relation between Jonas Bronk and DWB.
Bronk, Helen. Obituary news and notes.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Correspondence re: salary information removed to Confidential files.

processinfo.p: Notes, numbered with hand-stamp in original order by Ruth Sternfeld.

did.unittitle: Published article. DWB "Dictator, Marvelous Old Friendship Sloop Revived!" Ellsworth American, Ellsworth, ME, page 15.
Institute for Advanced Study. DWB note attached to copy of letter from John von Neumann/Lewis L. Strauss. Re: DWB and others as possible directors of Institute for Advanced Study.
Michigan, University of: Notifications of Appointments
Navy Department: 1935 correspondence re: DWB history of service, 1918-1922

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: "Schedule", c. 1925, found in bound copy of DWB Ph.D. thesis; note attached to 1960 invitation to premiere of movie on Wernher von Braun.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: RAC is unable to provide access to obsolete media and original digital media. In addition separated media may not yet have undergone stabilization procedures. When feasible, a digital surrogate may be created via special order. All applicable charges will apply. See RAC Head of Archival Services or RAC Head of Digital Programs for details.
